meanings.definition: Most devoted or loyal in religious worship or practice.
meanings.sent1: She is the devoutest member of our church, always attending every service.
meanings.sent2: The nun's devoutest prayers were heard by all in the convent.
meanings.sent3: The devoutest believer in the town was known for always carrying a lucky rabbit's foot.
meanings.sent4: His commitment to his faith was so strong, he was like the devoutest oak tree in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The image of her kneeling in prayer was the devoutest memory he held in his heart.

meanings.definition: Most sincere or earnest in feelings or intentions.
meanings.sent1: Her devoutest apologies were not enough to mend the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: He expressed his devoutest gratitude for the help he received during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The devoutest promise he made was to always keep her secret safe.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush moved with the devoutest care as he painted the masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: His eyes showed the devoutest love as he looked at his newborn baby for the first time.
